alert.note: Alert for Ashley (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:18AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ashley County through 500 AM CDT... At 418 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fountain Hill to West Crossett. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Snyder around 455 AM CDT. Portland, Montrose and Berlin around 500 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Blanchton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
